subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] An international QS version of "Through The Looking-Glass"
msgSnippet: ... For my part I would recommend that you use double quotes rather than single quotes for speech and citation. It s what Carroll used (it s not an
messageBody:
On 27 Jul 2009, at 00:51, peter_r_guinness wrote:
> I've uploaded Lewis Carroll's book "Through The Looking-Glass" re-
> written using my international QS proposal rules.
>
For my part I would recommend that you use "double quotes" rather than
'single quotes' for speech and citation. It's what Carroll used (it's
not an Americanism, and it makes it easier to let the apostrophe be
the apostrophe. "Though in 'nesting' the single returns" and there is
some of that in TTLG.

Michael Everson * http://www.evertype.com/

> I've uploaded Lewis Carroll's book "Through The Looking-Glass" re- 
> written using my international QS proposal rules.
>
For my part I would recommend that you use "double quotes" rather than  
'single quotes' for speech and citation. It's what Carroll used (it's  
not an Americanism, and it makes it easier to let the apostrophe be  
the apostrophe. "Though in 'nesting' the single returns" and there is  
some of that in TTLG.
